name: Great  Roles the Stars Bypassed Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Kim Novak was the female lead in "Vertigo", but Hitchcock's first choice for the role was someone else. Who?
questions.explanation:
Vera Miles.

	Miles was the actress of choice for the role - but she got pregnant. Hitchcock was not a happy camper.

questions.text: Gary Cooper did a tremendous job in "High Noon", but only got the chance because another star "passed" on the role. Who?
questions.explanation:
Gregory Peck.

	Peck had recently starred in "The Gunfighter" and didn't want to do a "similar" film.

questions.text: Joan Crawford won an Oscar for "Mildred Pierce", but she was not the first choice for the role. Who was?
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	Bette Davis and Barbara Stanwyck reportedly both passed on the role.

questions.text: Humphrey Bogart got a big break when this actor turned down a starring role in "High Sierra" (and in "Maltese Falcon").
questions.explanation:
George Raft.

	Raft "passed". He didn't like "Sierra" and didn't know newcomer Huston (who directed "Falcon").

questions.text: Buddy Ebsen lost a chance to be in this classic musical due to illness.
questions.explanation:
Wizard of Oz.

	Ebsen developed an allergic reaction to the "tin man" make-up - and that cost him the role of a lifetime.

questions.text: Errol Flynn got a break when he was offered the lead in "Captain Blood", but he wasn't the first choice for the role. Who was?
questions.explanation:
Robert Donat.

	It was Flynn's "big break". Good movie - and he handled the titlerole well.

questions.text: Monty Woolley was sensational in "The Man Who Came To Dinner", but he wasn't the first choice for the part. Who was?
questions.explanation:
John Barrymore.

	Bette Davis (who co-starred in the movie) wanted to work with Barrymore, but Barrymore didn't get the role. Davis was quite angry - but Woolley was absolutely wonderful in the role.

questions.text: Harrison Ford may forever be known as Indiana Jones, but he wasn't the original candidate for the role in "Raiders of the Lost Ark". Who was?
questions.explanation:
Tom Selleck.

	Selleck couldn't get out of his "Magnum, P.I." obligations, so Ford was in.

questions.text: Olivia DeHavilland wasn't the original choice for her starring role in "Hush, Hush, Sweet Charlotte". Who was?
questions.explanation:
Joan Crawford.

	It was meant to be a follow-up to "Whatever Happened to Baby Jane?" with a re-teaming of Bette Davis and Joan Crawford. It started out that way, but Davis and Crawford didn't get along, so Olivia replaced Joan.

questions.text: Who of the following was NOT considered for one of the two starring roles in "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid"?
questions.explanation:
Dean Martin.

	There was talk that Newman would play Sundance, not Butch. I can seeMcQueen as one of the two, but I don't know about the others.
